item.title: The Lynx and the Hare
item.description: x = 3.1415 [!notes] Meta info Comments Introduction We use a lot of tools to make sense of the world around us. Even without the advent of mathematics, people have been leveraging problem solving techniques, knowingly or unknowingly in one form or another, to provide solutions to problems or rationalizations to phenomena. For instance, our parents may have advised us not to shower in the rain as they have associated this with sickness.

item.title: Project 2: Ball Image Classifier
item.description: For this example project I built a ball classifier to identify balls from different sports. This could be useful for someone who is new to sports from a certain country. They could take a picture of a ball and an app could serve them some information about the history and rules of the game. This is the underlying model for building something with those capabilities. I was able to get the model to predict the sport of the ball with 94% accuracy after minimal tuning.

item.title: Project 1: Data Science Salary Estimator
item.description: Created a tool that estimates data science salaries (MAE ~ $ 11K) to help data scientists negotiate their income when they get a job. Scraped over 1000 job descriptions from glassdoor using python and selenium Engineered features from the text of each job description to quantify the value companies put on python, excel, aws, and spark. Optimized Linear, Lasso, and Random Forest Regressors using GridsearchCV to reach the best model.
